If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature take any remaining damage.

subclassFeature.name: Versatile Direction
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can take a second bonus action on each of your turns.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Reinforced Barriers
entries: At 14th level, when you cast a tech power while you have a barrier active, you can restore hit points to the barrier, provided it is within 30 feet of you. You restore a number of hit points equal to twice the power’s level, or 1 hit point for an at-will power. This can’t increase a barrier’s hit points above its initial hit points. If you have multiple barriers active, you can divide these hit points between them as you see fit.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Barrier
entries: Starting at 18th level, when a creature who has one of your barriers within 30 feet of you that you can see takes damage, and that damage is of a type that could be affected by that barrier, you can use your reaction to grant them resistance to the triggering damage. If that damage is the same type as the barrier’s chosen damage, you instead grant them immunity. Whether resistance or immunity, the barrier immediately drops to 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Engineering
entries: Those engineers who choose the Unstable Engineering discipline create and use untested combinations, resulting in powerful—and often unpredictable—effects.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in a set of implements of your choice. Additionally, when you engage in crafting with {@item tinker's implements}, the rate at which you craft doubles.

subclassFeature.name: Modified Tinkercannon
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn to enhance your tinker’s implements with unstable science, modifying them into a harness with a cannon. Over the course of a long rest, you can modify your tinker’s implements to create a tinkercannon. You must have tinker’s implements in order to perform this modification.

Whenever you cast a tech power of 1st level or higher while wielding your tinkercannon, you risk unexpected complications. Your GM can have you roll a d20. If you roll a 1, roll on the Unstable Engineering Surge table to create a random effect.

Additionally, your tinkercannon come equipped with four overrides, and they gain more at higher levels, as shown in the Modification Slots column of the Engineer table. Each time you trigger an Unstable Engineering Surge, you can use an override to reroll the percentile dice. You must use the new result, you can only do this once per surge, and each time you do so in excess of your proficiency bonus (resetting on a long rest) your maximum tech points is reduced by 1 until you complete a long rest. You regain all expended overrides when you complete a long rest.

entries.caption: Unstable Engineering Surge
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
For the next minute, you can see any invisible creature if you have line of sight to it.
A DRK-1 tracker droid appears with 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell explosion|sw5e_phb} at 3rd-level centered on yourself without expending tech points.
You cast {@spell homing rockets|sw5e_phb} at 5th-level without expending tech points.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll: if odd, you shrink; if even, you grow.
You fall asleep standing for 1 minute or until you take damage.
For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns
You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze.
You cast {@spell oil slick|sw5e_phb} centered on yourself without expending tech points.
Creatures have disadvantage on the first saving throw they make against you in the next minute.
Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. Any effect that ends a curse ends this.
You grow an extra eye, granting advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight for 1 minute.
For the next minute, all your tech powers with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
You take {@dice 2d10} lightning damage and are shocked for 1 minute.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging tech power you cast within the next minute.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll: if odd, younger; if even, older.
You start running uncontrollably for 1 minute, moving your entire speed each turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you is subjected to the {@spell gleaming outline} tech power for 1 minute.
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
You are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.
You have disadvantage on the first ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you make each turn for 1 minute.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
A shimmering energy barrier grants you a +2 bonus to AC for 1 minute.
You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours. If you don't have hair, you instead grow it for 24 hours.
For 1 minute, any flammable object not worn or carried you touch bursts into flame.
You regain tech points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one).
For the next minute, you shout whenever you speak.
You cast {@spell smoke cloud} centered on yourself without expending tech points.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@dice 4d10} lightning damage.
You are frightened by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes invisible for 1 minute, or until it attacks or casts a power.
You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes poisoned for {@dice 1d4} hours.
You emit bright light in a 30-foot radius for 1 minute.
Each creature within 30 feet of you except you gains the benefits of {@spell mirror image} for 1 minute.
Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
You can take one additional action immediately.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage and you gain hit points equal to the damage.
You cast {@spell mirror image|sw5e_phb} without expending tech points.
You are frozen in carbonite and {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute or until you take damage.
You turn {@condition invisible} and can't make sound for 1 minute, or until you attack or cast a power.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell defibrillate} power.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to energy damage for the next minute.
You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
You regain half your expended tech points.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Volley
entries: Lastly at 3rd level, while wielding your tinkercannon, as a bonus action you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Potent Aptitude|Engineer|sw5e_phb|1} to launch a volley of unstable energy at a surface located within 30 feet of you that you can see. This energy adheres to the surface for 1 minute, after which it erupts. As a part of this bonus action, or as a bonus action on a following turn, you can cause the energy to erupt early. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw against your tech save DC. A creature takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
The range at which you can launch your volley increases to 60 feet at 9th level, and 120 feet at 17th level.
This damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to {@damage 2d6} at 5th level, {@damage 3d6} at 11th level, and {@damage 4d6} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Creative Destruction
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can add your governing ability modifier (minimum of +1) to any damage you deal with tech powers and class features that don’t already include that modifier. If the tech power or class feature would damage multiple creatures, you can only deal this additional damage to one of them.
If you choose to deal this additional damage, your GM can have you roll on the {@table Unstable Engineering Surge|sw5e_phb} table.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Overrides
entries: At 14th level, you gain a modicum of control over your surges. Whenever you roll on the {@table Unstable Engineering Surge|sw5e_phb} table and use one of your overrides, you can choose either total.

subclassFeature.name: Engineering Bombardment
entries: Starting at 18th level, the harmful energies of your tech powers and class features intensify. When you roll damage for a tech power or class feature and roll the highest number possible on any of the dice, you can roll it again and use both results. You can only use this ability once per tech power or class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Assault Specialist
entries: Those fighters who choose to become Assault Specialists focus on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Assault Specialists combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

subclassFeature.name: Brute Force
entries: Once per turn, when you deal damage with a weapon, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d4} damage of the same type as the weapon’s damage. If this damage would affect multiple creatures, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.
This damage increases to {@damage 1d6} at 5th level, {@damage 1d8} at 9th level, {@damage 1d10} at 13th level, and {@damage 1d12} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: You can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn’t already use your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Brutish Durability
entries: Once per round, roll {@dice 1d6} and add the die to your saving throw total. If applying this bonus to a death saving throw increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the d20. You can choose to use this feature before or after you make a saving throw, but you must decide before the GM says whether the save succeeds or fails.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: You can choose a second {@filter fighting style|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=FS:SW5e} option.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Critical
entries: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to that weapon’s damage roll equal to your fighter level.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor
entries: You attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half your hit points left. You don’t gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy Weapons Specialist
entries: Some manned instruments of war require their user to have superior physical prowess to overcome their weight and encumbrance. Those fighters who choose to become Heavy Weapons Specialists use their powerful bodies, and powerful armaments, to overwhelm their foes.

entries.subclassFeature: My Little Friend Says Hello There|Fighter|sw5e_phb|Heavy Weapons|sw5e_phb|3|sw5e_phb

subclassFeature.name: Rock Steady
entries: You have learned to use the heft of your weapon to root yourself in place. At the end of each of your turns, if you move less than half your speed while wielding a weapon with the Heavy or Strength properties, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition restrained}, {@condition moved}, or knocked {@condition prone}. This advantage lasts until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: My Little Friend Says Hello There
entries: You know how to use the sheer size of your weapon to strike fear in those around you. You can add your Strength modifier to any Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check you make while wielding a weapon with the heavy or strength properties that doesn’t already include that modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Maximum Output
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action while wielding a weapon with the Heavy or Strength properties, you can forgo one or more attacks. If you do so, the first time you deal damage with the weapon before the start of your next turn, you deal additional damage of the same type as the weapon’s damage. If this instance would deal damage to multiple creatures, you can only apply this additional damage to one of them. For each attack you forgo, you deal additional damage equal to {@damage 1d12} + half your fighter level (rounded down). If you miss with the first attack roll you make before the end of your next turn, or one target succeeds on the saving throw against your weapon’s Burst or Rapid property, you instead deal normal weapon damage.

subclassFeature.name: Straight Through
entries: When you score a critical hit on your turn while wielding a weapon with the heavy or strength properties, you can make one weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet of the target using your reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelm
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter|sw5e_phb|1} while wielding a weapon with the Heavy or Strength properties, if you hit with the first attack roll you make, or if one creatures fails the saving throw against your weapon’s Burst or Rapid property, before the end of your next turn, you treat the hit as a critical hit. If you miss with the first attack roll you make before the end of your next turn, or one target succeeds on the saving throw against your weapon’s burst or rapid property, you instead deal normal weapon damage.

subclassFeature.name: Pure Performance
entries: At 18th level, attack rolls you make while wielding a weapon with the Heavy or Strength properties can’t suffer from disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Specialist
entries: Those fighters who choose to become Shield Specialists train to bolster those around them. They can inspire their allies with renewed vigor, lifting them to new heights, while simultaneously protecting them from harm.

subclassFeature.name: Techcasting
entries: You have derived powers from schematics with the aid of your wristpad. See chapter 10 for the general rules of techcasting and chapter 12 for the tech powers list.

entries.name: Tech Powers Known
entries: You learn 3 tech powers of your choice, and you learn more at higher levels, as shown in the Tech Powers Known column of the Shield Specialist Techcasting table. You may not learn a tech power of a level higher than your Max Power Level.

entries.name: Tech Points
entries: You have a number of tech points equal to half your fighter level (rounded up), as shown in the Tech Points column of the Shield Specialist Techcasting table, + your Intelligence modifier. You use these tech points to cast tech powers. You regain all expended tech points when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Max Power Level
entries: Many tech powers can be overcharged, consuming more tech points to create a greater effect. You can overcharge these powers to a maximum level, which increases at higher levels, as shown in the Max Power Level column of the Shield Specialist Techcasting table.
You may only cast tech powers at 4th-level once. You regain the ability to do so after a long rest.

entries.name: Techcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your techcasting ability for your tech powers. You use your Intelligence whenever a power refers to your techcasting ability. Additionally, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a tech power you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Techcasting Focus
entries: You use a {@item wristpad|sw5e_phb} as a tech focus for your tech powers.

subclassFeature.name: Stay In Formation
entries: You can take the {@action Guard} action as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Cry
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter|sw5e_phb|1} feature, you can choose up to three creatures within 60 feet of you that are allied with you. Each one regains hit points equal to your fighter level, provided that the creature can see or hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Surge
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Action Surge (1 use)|Fighter|sw5e_phb|2||Action Surge} feature, you can choose one creature within 60 feet of you that is allied with you. That creature can make one melee or ranged weapon attack with its reaction, provided that it can see or hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark
entries: You can extend the benefit of your {@classFeature Indomitable (2 uses)|Fighter|sw5e_phb|13||Indomitable} feature to an ally. When you decide to use Indomitable to reroll an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw and you aren’t {@condition incapacitated}, you can choose one ally within 60 feet of you that also failed its saving throw against the same effect. If that creature can see or hear you, it can reroll its saving throw and must use the new roll.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Inspiring Surge
entries: You can choose two allies within 60 feet of you, rather than one, when you using your {@subclassFeature Inspiring Surge|Fighter|sw5e_phb|Shield|sw5e_phb|10} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Specialist
entries: Those fighters who choose to become Tactical Specialists employ martial techniques passed down through generations. To a Tactical Specialist, combat is an academic field, sometimes including subjects beyond battle such as armstech or armormech. Not every fighter absorbs the lessons of history, theory, and artistry that are reflected in the Tactical Specialty, but those who do are well-rounded fighters of great skill and knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency in your choice of {@filter artisan’s implements|items|type=artisan's implements}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: Your tactical skill in combat improves, granting bonuses to your Combat Superiority.

entries.name: Improved Maneuvers
entries: You know four maneuvers of your choice, instead of two, and you earn more at higher levels, as shown in the Maneuvers Known column of the Tactical Specialist Combat Superiority table.

entries.name: Improved Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, instead of two, and you earn more at higher levels, as shown in the Combat Superiority column of the Tactical Specialist Combat Superiority table.

subclassFeature.name: Signature Maneuver
entries: You choose a maneuver you know from this class as your signature maneuver. Whenever you use that maneuver, you can use it without expending a Superiority Dice. You may only use this feature once per round.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The GM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: Strength score
Dexterity score
Constitution score
Armor Class
Current hit points
Total class levels (if any)
Fighter class levels (if any)

subclassFeature.name: Greater Signature Maneuver
entries: You can choose a second signature maneuver.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: When you roll initiative and have no Superiority Dice remaining, you regain 1 Superiority Die.

subclassFeature.name: Maneuver Mastery
entries: Once per round, when you would roll a Superiority Die, you can instead choose the maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Makashi Form
entries: Makashi Form, also known as Contention Form, encourages precision and efficiency over power, using jabs, parries and light cuts over slashes, blocks and chops. Those guardians who focus on Makashi Form utilize calculated blade manipulation, intense focus, and expert timing to confuse and trap their opponents.

subclassFeature.name: Form Basics
entries: You gain the Makashi lightsaber form, detailed in Chapter 6. If you already know this form, you can instead choose another lightsaber form.

subclassFeature.name: The Way of the Ysalamiri
entries: As a bonus action, you can enter an offensive stance for one minute. While in this stance, you add your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice) to the first melee weapon attack and damage rolls you make each turn.
This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel the Force
entries: You gain the following Channel the Force option.

entries.name: Makashi Riposte
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can expend a use of your Channel the Force and use your reaction to attempt to deflect the attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier + your guardian level.
If you reduce the damage to 0, you can immediately make a single melee weapon attack against that creature as a part of the reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Shatterpoint
entries: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can use your connection to the Force to sense their strengths and weaknesses, and learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The GM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: Strength score
Dexterity score
Wisdom score
Charisma score
Armor Class
Current hit points
Total class levels (if any)
Total Forcecaster levels (if any)

subclassFeature.name: Glancing Blow
entries: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Contention
entries: You are a duelist of the highest caliber. Your Dexterity and Wisdom or Charisma scores (your choice) increase by 2. Your maximum for those scores increases by 2. Additionally, you can use your action to gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to kinetic and energy damage, and you ignore resistance to kinetic and energy damage.
All melee attacks have disadvantage against you.
Your melee weapon attacks inflict an additional damage die.

entries: This effect ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or dead. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Niman Form
entries: Niman Form, also known as Moderation Form, strikes a balance between bladework and force powers. Those guardians who focus on Niman Form weave Force manipulation with their melee weapon strikes, pushing their opponents off-balance to create an opening.

subclassFeature.name: Form Basics
entries: You gain the Niman lightsaber form, detailed in Chapter 6. If you already know this form, you can instead choose another lightsaber form.

subclassFeature.name: The Way of the Rancor
entries: As a bonus action, you can enter a balanced stance for one minute. As a part of this bonus action, and as a bonus action on each of your turns, when you use your action to cast a force power, you can make one melee weapon attack. Additionally, for the duration, you can use Wisdom or Charisma instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of your melee weapon attacks. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel the Force
entries: You gain the following Channel the Force option.

entries.name: Telekinetic Slash
entries: When you deal damage with an at-will force power that requires a force attack or a saving throw, you can expend a use of your Channel the Force and expend force points to deal additional damage to the target, which is the same type as the power’s damage. The additional damage is 1d8 for each point spent in this way. You can’t deal more additional damage than the amount shown in the Focused Strikes column of the guardian table.

subclassFeature.name: Enlightenment
entries: You can add half your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice, rounded down, minimum of one) to any saving throw you make that doesn’t already include that modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Redirect
entries: When you would be affected by a weapon or force power that requires a Dexterity saving throw or attack roll and would affect only you, you can use your reaction to redirect that power to another target within 30 feet. If the weapon or power required a melee or ranged attack, make a melee or ranged force attack against the new target, as appropriate. If it required a Dexterity saving throw, the new target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your universal force save DC.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Moderation
entries: The Force flows in perfect concert with your weapon attacks. Your Dexterity and Wisdom or Charisma scores (your choice) increase by 2. Your maximum for these scores increases by 2. Additionally, you can use your action to gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to kinetic and energy damage from unenhanced weapons.
You have advantage on saving throws against force powers. Additionally, you have resistance against the damage of force powers.
When you use your action to cast an at-will force power that targets only one creature, you can target an additional creature within 5 feet of the original target and within the power’s range.

entries: This effect ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or dead. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shien/Djem So Form
entries: Shien/Djem So Form, also known as Perseverance Form, utilizes a force-enhanced strength to overwhelm opponents. Those guardians who focus on Shien/Djem So Form actively attempt to force an opening rather than waiting for the opportunity to present itself.

entries.subclassFeature: The Way of the Krayt Dragon|Guardian|sw5e_phb|Shien/Djem So|sw5e_phb|3|sw5e_phb

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency in heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Form Basics
entries: You gain the Shien/Djem So lightsaber form, detailed in Chapter 6. If you already know this form, you can instead choose another lightsaber form.

subclassFeature.name: The Way of the Krayt Dragon
entries: As a bonus action, you can take a threatening stance for one minute. While in this stance, the first time you hit with a melee weapon attack using Strength each turn, you can attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.
This effect ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or dead. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel the Force
entries: You gain one of the following Channel the Force options. Choose Blade Barrier for Shien or Falling Avalanche for Djem So.

entries.name: Blade Barrier
entries: On your turn, when you deal melee weapon damage that includes your Strength modifier, you can forgo your Strength modifier to the damage roll, expend a use of your Channel the Force (no action required), and reduce your speed by half. If you do so, energy and kinetic damage you take from weapons before the end of your next turn is reduced by an amount equal to your Strength modifier. You can not use this feature if you have moved more than half your speed this turn.

entries.name: Falling Avalanche
entries: On your turn, you can expend a use of your Channel the Force (no action required) and reduce your speed by half to gain advantage on the next ability check or attack roll you make using Strength before the end of your next turn. You can not use this feature if you have moved more than half your speed this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Determination
entries: You gain one of the following features. Choose Aggressive Negotiations for Shien or Reliable Vigor for Djem So.

entries.name: Aggressive Negotiations
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) or Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to half your Strength modifier (rounded down) if it doesn’t already include that modifier.

entries.name: Reliable Vigor
entries: If your total for a Strength check or saving throw is less than your guardian level, you can use your guardian level in place of the total.

subclassFeature.name: Presence
entries: You gain one of the following features. Choose Precise Reflection for Shien or Brutal Strikes for Djem So.

entries.name: Precise Reflection
entries: When you hit with an attack made by the {@spell saber reflect|sw5e_phb} power, you can expend force points to deal additional damage to the target, which is the same type as the weapon’s damage. The additional damage is 1d8 for each point spent in this way. You can’t deal more additional damage than the amount shown in the Focused Strikes column of the guardian table.

entries.name: Brutal Strikes
entries: The Force flowing through you grants you incredible strength. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a {@classFeature Force-Empowered Strikes|Guardian|sw5e_phb|2} or {@classFeature Improved Force-Empowered Strikes|Guardian|sw5e_phb|11} damage die, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.
Additionally, when you spend force points to use your Force-Empowered Strikes feature, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice the number of points spent.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Perseverance
entries: Your might overwhelms even the most implacable of foes. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 2. Your maximum for these scores increases by 2. Additionally, you can use your action to gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to kinetic and energy damage from unenhanced weapons.

Once per turn, when you hit with a melee weapon attack using Strength, you can use your {@classFeature Force-Empowered Strikes|Guardian|sw5e_phb|2} feature at 1st-level without expending force points. You gain temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to make a single weapon attack with advantage against that creature. If the attack hits, you impose disadvantage on the triggering attack roll.

entries: This effect ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or dead. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Soresu Form
entries: Soresu Form, also known as Resilience Form, relies on tight bladework and subtle dodges to provide maximum defensive coverage, minimizing exposure to ranged weaponry. Those guardians who focus on Soresu Form use broad footwork to move around the playing field, making broad, short sweeping motions that protect the body.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency in heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Form Basics
entries: You gain the Soresu lightsaber form, detailed in Chapter 6. If you already know this form, you can instead choose another lightsaber form.

subclassFeature.name: The Way of the Mynock
entries: As a bonus action, you can enter a defensive stance for one minute. As a part of this bonus action, and as a bonus action on each of your turns, you can cast the {@spell saber ward} power. When you do so, you have a number of special reactions equal to your proficiency bonus that you can only use to cast the {@spell saber reflect} force power. You can only take one reaction per turn.
This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel the Force
entries: You gain the following Channel the Force option.

entries.name: Advancing Defender
entries: When you cast the {@spell saber reflect} power, you can expend a use of your Channel the Force to move up to 10 feet as a part of that same reaction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Shelter
entries: You learn to fend off strikes directed at you or other creatures nearby. If you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to ward the creature if you’re wielding a melee weapon or a shield. Roll {@dice 1d8} and add the number rolled to the target’s AC against that attack. If the attack still hits, the target has resistance against the attack’s damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stand Against the Tide
entries: When a hostile creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force that creature to repeat the same attack against another creature (other than itself) of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Resilience
entries: Your presence on the field of battle is an inspiration to your allies. Your Constitution and Wisdom or Charisma scores (your choice) increase by 2. Your maximum for those scores increases by 2. Additionally, you can use your action to gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to kinetic and energy damage from unenhanced weapons.
When you use the {@spell saber reflect|sw5e_phb} force power, you can make a single melee attack on an enemy within 5ft of you as a part of that same reaction.
You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, as do your allies within 30 feet of you.

entries: This effect ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or dead. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

language.name: Bothese
entries: Bothese had a great influence on the forming of Galactic Basic; the two languages share many cognates.

language.name: Cerean
entries: Cerean is characterized by its gravelly sounds.

language.name: Cheunh
entries: Cheunh is a complex language that is difficult for non-chiss to learn. Chiss take pride in this difficulty.

language.name: Devaronese
entries: Devaronese is characterized by grunts and grumbles. It is rare to hear a Devaronian speak it anywhere other than their homeworld of Devaron.

language.name: Durese
entries: Durese is a common interstellar tongue used by prominent spacers and traders.

language.name: Gamorrese
entries: Gamorrese is characterized by its grunts and squeals, and its writing is a crude, pictographic style.

language.name: Jawaese
entries: Jawaese blends quickly spoken, semi-meaningless syllables with scents to be understood.

language.name: Nautila
entries: Nautila is unique in that it can only be properly pronounced underwater due to its use of pheromones in addition to spoken sounds. In any other environment, the language loses a great amount of detail; that Nautolans find this annoying.

language.name: Sith
entries: Sith is an agglutinative language, in which words or even phrases were made up of linears sequences of distinct meaningful units.

language.name: Togruti
entries: Togruti is an ornate language characterized by trills and long vowel sounds which are modified by subtle tremors in the togruta’s head-tails. This language is heavily influenced by Basic, but also incorporates some native idioms, which cause Basic-speaking togruta to use seemingly strange expressions.

language.name: Dosh
entries: Dosh is characterized by its harsh grunts, hisses and growls, and its written form that used alphabetic glyphs.

language.name: Tusken
entries: Tusken is a guttural language characterized by its barks, growls, and roars.

table.name: Classes
rows: Melee combatant who utilizes rage to increase prowess
Force-wielder who focuses on utilizing force powers
Tech caster who enhances items to benefit allies
Versatile combatant who excels at both range and in melee
Unarmed combatant who uses focus to fuel abilities
Controller who focuses on stealth and techniques
Academic who uses wits and allies to control the battlefield
Versatile combatant who blends tech powers with weapons
Force-wielder who blends melee combat with the Force

table.name: Unstable Engineering Surge
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
For the next minute, you can see any invisible creature if you have line of sight to it.
A DRK-1 tracker droid appears with 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell explosion|sw5e_phb} at 3rd-level centered on yourself without expending tech points.
You cast {@spell homing rockets|sw5e_phb} at 5th-level without expending tech points.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll: if odd, you shrink; if even, you grow.
You fall asleep standing for 1 minute or until you take damage.
For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns
You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze.
You cast {@spell oil slick|sw5e_phb} centered on yourself without expending tech points.
Creatures have disadvantage on the first saving throw they make against you in the next minute.
Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. Any effect that ends a curse ends this.
You grow an extra eye, granting advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight for 1 minute.
For the next minute, all your tech powers with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
You take {@dice 2d10} lightning damage and are shocked for 1 minute.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging tech power you cast within the next minute.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll: if odd, younger; if even, older.
You start running uncontrollably for 1 minute, moving your entire speed each turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you is subjected to the {@spell gleaming outline} tech power for 1 minute.
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
You are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.
You have disadvantage on the first ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you make each turn for 1 minute.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
A shimmering energy barrier grants you a +2 bonus to AC for 1 minute.
You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours. If you don't have hair, you instead grow it for 24 hours.
For 1 minute, any flammable object not worn or carried you touch bursts into flame.
You regain tech points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one).
For the next minute, you shout whenever you speak.
You cast {@spell smoke cloud} centered on yourself without expending tech points.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@dice 4d10} lightning damage.
You are frightened by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes invisible for 1 minute, or until it attacks or casts a power.
You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes poisoned for {@dice 1d4} hours.
You emit bright light in a 30-foot radius for 1 minute.
Each creature within 30 feet of you except you gains the benefits of {@spell mirror image} for 1 minute.
Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
You can take one additional action immediately.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage and you gain hit points equal to the damage.
You cast {@spell mirror image|sw5e_phb} without expending tech points.
You are frozen in carbonite and {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute or until you take damage.
You turn {@condition invisible} and can't make sound for 1 minute, or until you attack or cast a power.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell defibrillate} power.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to energy damage for the next minute.
You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
You regain half your expended tech points.

optionalfeature.name: Acklay's Instinct
entries: While raging, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Bantha's Instinct
entries: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

optionalfeature.name: Blurrg's Instinct
entries: Whether mounted or on foot, your travel pace is doubled, as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they’re within 60 feet of you and you’re not {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Boggdo's Instinct
entries: While raging you have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed, though you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.

optionalfeature.name: Chirodactyl's Instinct
entries: While raging, you have {@sense blindsight} to a range of 30 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sound, as long as you aren’t deafened.

optionalfeature.name: Dewback's Instinct
entries: Choose three damage types. While raging, you have resistance to the chosen damage types.

optionalfeature.name: Fighter's Instinct
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the Fighting Style options. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=FS:SW5e} page. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

optionalfeature.name: Fyrnock's Instinct
entries: While raging, you can use your bonus action to leap up to 30 feet to an empty space you can see. When you land you deal kinetic damage equal to your Strength modifier to each creature within 5 feet of where you land. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Hawk's Instinct
entries: You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty. You are able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you. Additionally, dim light doesn’t impose disadvantage on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Katarn's Instinct
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: Loth-Cat's Instinct
entries: While you’re raging, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against you, and you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Predator's Instinct
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Rancor's Instinct
entries: While you’re raging any creature within 5 feet of you that’s hostile to you has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you or another character with this feature. An enemy is immune to this effect if it can’t see or hear you or if it can’t be {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Tactician's Instinct
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Reckless Attack|Berserker|sw5e_phb|2} feature, you can choose to not have advantage on your attack rolls this turn. If you do so, friendly creatures within 5 feet of a hostile creature that is within 5 feet of you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Tracker's Instinct
entries: You can track other creatures while traveling at a fast pace, and you can move stealthily while traveling at a normal pace.

optionalfeature.name: Terentatek's Instinct
entries: When you are forced to make a saving throw against a force power, you can immediately use your reaction to move up to half your speed towards the source power’s caster. If you end this movement within 5 feet of the target, you can immediately make one melee weapon attack against the target as a part of that reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Varactyl's Instinct
entries: While raging, you have advantage Dexterity checks, your attack rolls can’t suffer from disadvantage, and each slowed level only reduces your speed by 5 feet, unless it would reduce your speed to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Power
entries: When you cast a power that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the power’s full force. To do so, you spend 1 additional force point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice, minimum of one). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the power.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Power
entries: When you cast a power that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 additional force point to double the range of the power.
Alternatively, when you cast a power that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 additional force point to make the range of the power 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Power
entries: When you cast a power that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 additional force point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Power
entries: When you cast a power that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 3 additional force points to give one target of the power disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the power.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Power
entries: When you roll damage for a power, you can spend 1 additional force point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Wisdom or Charisma modifier (your choice, minimum of one). You must use the new rolls.
You can use Improved Power even if you have already used a different Force-Empowered Casting option during the casting of the power.

optionalfeature.name: Lingering Power
entries: When you cast a power that requires concentration to maintain you can choose to spend 3 additional force points. If you do, when you lose concentration on the power, the power will not end until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Pinpoint Power
entries: When you cast a power that allows you to force creatures in an area to make a saving throw you can instead spend 1 force point and make a ranged force attack against a single target that would be in the range. On a hit the target suffers the effects as though they failed their saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Power
entries: When you cast a power that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 additional force points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

optionalfeature.name: Refocused Power
entries: When you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a power you can use your reaction and spend 2 force points to automatically succeed on the saving throw.
You can use Refocused Power even if you have already used a different Force-Empowered Casting option during the casting of the power.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Power
entries: If you miss with a force power that calls for an attack roll, you can spend 2 force points to reroll the attack. You must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Power even if you have already used a different Force-Empowered Casting option during the casting of the power.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Power
entries: When you cast a power that targets only one creature and doesn’t have a range of self, you can spend a number of additional force points equal to the power’s level to target a second creature in range with the same power (1 force point if the power is at-will).

optionalfeature.name: Absorption Shield
entries: You modify your physical shield to block incoming damage. As a bonus action you can activate this ability and gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + Intelligence modifier, which last for one hour.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Accelerated Movement
entries: You reduce the weight of your modified armor’s bulk and increase the power to joints. If the armor has a Strength requirement, you ignore it. The modified armor’s weight is reduced by 15 lbs. While wearing your modified armor your speed increases by 10 feet. This applies to all movement speeds you have while wearing your armor.

optionalfeature.name: Adaptable Armor
entries: You integrate deployable hooks and fins into your armor, augmenting its mobility. While wearing your modified armor, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. Additionally, you gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Power Fist
entries: You further modify your modified armor’s gauntlet with increased reinforcement and weight. Your modified armor’s unarmed strike deals {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage. Additionally, your critical hit range with your unarmed strikes increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Artificially Intelligent
entries: You install an artificial intelligence into your modified armor. While wearing your modified armor, when you make an ability check, your armor’s artificial intelligence can take the {@action Help} action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bonded Plates
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against melee attacks. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Collapsible Suit
entries: Your modified armor can collapse into a case for easy storage. When transformed this way the armor is indistinguishable from a normal case and weighs one-third its normal weight. As an action you can don or doff the armor, allowing it to transform as needed.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision Visor
entries: While wearing your modified armor, you have {@sense darkvision} to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, this modification increases its range by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points while wearing your modified armor but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Electroshock Shield
entries: You install electroshockers in your shield generator. Whenever an enemy misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to do {@dice 1d4} + your Intelligence modifier lightning damage to the attacker.

optionalfeature.name: Flight
entries: You integrate a propulsion system into your modified armor. While wearing your modified armor you have an enhanced flying speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Harpoon
entries: Your modified armor gains an integrated grappling harpoon set into your gauntlet. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While the harpoon is deployed, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is larger than you. A creature or object your size or smaller is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Heavy Suit
entries: You enhance your suit, making it difficult to move. As a bonus action, you can anchor your feet to the ground. While anchored, your speed is 0, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

optionalfeature.name: Infiltration Suit
entries: You install a cloaking device in your modified armor. This device has 2 charges. As an action you can use 1 charge to cast infiltrate targeting yourself.
The cloaking device regains all expended charges after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetized Shield
entries: You modify your physical shield such that when a melee weapon attack misses you by an amount less than or equal to your bonus to AC from your shield, the attacking creature must make a Strength check against your tech save DC. On a failed save, the creature’s weapon adheres to the shield. As an action, a creature can repeat this check. On a success, the weapon is freed.

optionalfeature.name: Overload Shield
entries: You modify your shield generator to overload. As an action you can overload your shield. Each Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of you must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw (their choice) against your tech save DC. On a failed save, they are pushed back 5 feet and knocked prone.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Power Fist
entries: You modify your modified armor gauntlet with increased reinforcement and weight. Your modified armor’s unarmed strike deals {@damage 1d4} kinetic damage.
Additionally, when you take the Attack action and make an unarmed attack, you can make an additional unarmed attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Prototype Power Fist
entries: You further modify your modified armor gauntlet with increased reinforcement and weight. Your modified armor’s unarmed strike deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage and has the following property.

If you or your target move at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before making an unarmed attack, the first unarmed attack you make deals additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Reinforced Underlay
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against ranged attacks. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Resistance
entries: You tune your modified armor against certain forms of damage. Choose acid, cold, fire, ion, lightning, or sonic damage. While wearing your modified armor you have resistance to that type of damage.
You can select this modification multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Sealed Suit
entries: As a bonus action you can hermetically seal your modified armor, giving you an air supply for up to 1 hour and making you immune to poison (but not curing you of existing poisoned conditions). Your armor regains 1 minute of air for every minute that you are not submerged and the armor is not sealed.
Additionally, while you are wearing your modified armor you are considered adapted to cold and hot climates as well as high altitude, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide.

optionalfeature.name: Sentient Armor
entries: Your artificial intelligence has learned to control the suit without you being in it. It is now a valid target of the {@spell tracker droid interface|sw5e_phb} tech power.

While your armor is acting independently, it uses your ability scores, saving throws, and skills, and it has hit points equal to your engineer level. If reduced to 0 hit points, it falls directly to the ground, and it can not be equipped again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Amplifier
entries: You modify your shield generator to project outward. As a bonus action you can amplify your shield until the start of your next turn. Each creature within 5 feet of you gains a bonus to AC equal to your shield’s bonus.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Anchor
entries: You modify your shield to be used as a portable source of cover. As an action, you can anchor or recover the shield. While anchored, you gain no benefit from a shield, and it does not require the use of a hand. Instead, while anchored, a light shield provides one-quarter cover, a medium shield provides half cover, and a large shield provides three-quarters cover.

optionalfeature.name: Tech Blast
entries: You modify your modified armor gauntlet with a blaster weapon with which you are proficient. The weapon uses your Intelligence modifier for its attack and damage rolls, and deals {@damage 1d8} energy damage on a hit. It has a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Integration Armoring
entries: You can integrate a single weapon that weighs no more than 8 lb. into your armor. While integrated, that weapon gains the hidden property. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength saving throws to avoid being disarmed.

optionalfeature.name: Accuracy Focus
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Amplifying Barrel
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Bayonet
entries: You affix a short blade to the barrel of your modified blaster weapon, allowing you to make a melee weapon attack with it. The blade is a melee weapon with the finesse property that you are proficient with, and deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Burst Core
entries: Your weapon gains the burst property, with a burst number equal to its reload number.

optionalfeature.name: Booming Strikes
entries: You pack extra power into your modified weapon. Once per turn, when you hit with the weapon, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage. If you do so, the weapon makes a loud boom which can be heard 100 feet away. If you are hidden, Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to locate you that rely on sound have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Celerity Oscillator
entries: Once per turn, when you deal damage with your modified weapon, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, and the damaged creature can’t make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Collapsible Frame
entries: You install an expandable hilt on your modified weapon. Your modified weapon gains the reach property.

optionalfeature.name: Contoured Grip
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Expanded Magazine
entries: Your modified weapon can be more efficiently reloaded. You can reload your modified weapon once without using an action. You can’t use this feature again until you reload the weapon with an action.

optionalfeature.name: Flashlight
entries: You affix a targeted light to your weapon. As a bonus action, you can toggle the light on or off. While on, your weapon sheds bright light in a 60-foot cone.

optionalfeature.name: Harpoon Reel
entries: You install a secondary firemode that launches a harpoon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this harpoon, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d6} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the harpoon. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the harpoon. Removing the harpoon requires a Strength check. While the harpoon is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While connected in this manner, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you recover and reinsert the harpoon as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Imbue Weapon
entries: You modify your weapon to carry a charge. Over the course of a short rest, you can cast an at-will tech power, channeling it into your weapon. The next time you hit with your weapon, the stored power is released. If the power would require an attack roll, make a tech attack roll. If the power would require a saving throw, the target must make the saving throw as normal. On a hit, or a failure, the target suffers the power’s normal effects.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Burst Core
entries: Your weapon’s burst number is reduced to half its reload number.

optionalfeature.name: Integrated Magazine
entries: Your modified weapon can be more efficiently reloaded. You can reload your modified weapon twice without using an action. You can’t use this feature again until you reload the weapon with an action.

optionalfeature.name: Jagged Oscillator
entries: When you critically hit with the weapon, you deal an additional {@damage 1d8} kinetic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Oscillator
entries: Your weapon’s critical hit range increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Neutronium Edge
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Overcharge Weapon
entries: You gain the ability to channel your tech power to enhance your weapon’s damage. You can expend one tech slot to deal additional damage to the target. The extra damage is {@damage 1d6} for a 1st-level tech slot, plus {@damage 1d6} for each slot level higher than 1st, to a maximum of {@damage 5d6}. The damage is the same type as the weapon damage. If you also use your {@optfeature Booming Strikes|sw5e_phb} with an attack, you add this damage to the extra damage of your {@optfeature Booming Strikes|sw5e_phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Power Loop
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you can choose channel the energy generated, gaining temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Recoil Dampener
entries: You install a recoil dampener in your modified blaster, removing the strength property from it.

optionalfeature.name: Returning Weapon Guard
entries: You install a retractible chain in your modified vibroweapon. If the weapon does not already have the thrown property, it gains it with a range of 20/60. Additionally, it gains the returning property.

optionalfeature.name: Screening Weapon
entries: You modify your modified weapon with a sound dampening module. When you make a weapon attack with your weapon while hidden, {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Perception} checks made to locate you that rely on sound have disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Shock Absorber
entries: You add a reclamation device to your modified weapon to gather energy from the surroundings when it is present. While wielding your modified weapon, you can cast the absorb energy tech power and the power’s extra damage applies to both melee and ranged weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Siege Weapon
entries: You modify your weapon to be more effective against barriers. Your weapon deals double damage against structures.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Harpoon
entries: After hitting a creature with the harpoon fire mode, you can use the connection to deliver an at-will tech power. As a bonus action, you can cast an at-will tech power at the target with a range of touch. If the power requires an attack roll, you have advantage. If the target requires a saving throw, the target has disadvantage.
Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you recover the harpoon.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Oscillator
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you can create an electronic burst. Each creature in a 15-foot cone centered on the creature you hit must make a Dexterity saving throw against your tech save DC, taking {@damage 1d8} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Snap Fire
entries: You modify your modified blaster weapon for quick shots. You can use your reaction to take a opportunity attack with your modified weapon if an enemy comes within 10 feet of you. You have disadvantage on this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Stabilizer Cell
entries: You install a stabilizer cell in your modified vibroweapon, removing the dexterity property from it.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Oscillator
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed back 10 feet and knocked prone.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Tracker
entries: You add a tracking mechanism to your modified weapon. The tracker has 3 charges. As an action you can use 1 charge to cast target lock. As an action you can use 2 charges to cast {@spell detect invisibility|sw5e_phb}.
The tracker regains all expended charges after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Truelight
entries: When toggled on, your flashlight now automatically dispels illusions and can detect invisibility, as with truesight.

optionalfeature.name: Venomous Oscillator
entries: As a bonus action, you can coat your weapon in a thin layer of poison for 1 minute. The next time you hit with the weapon, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your tech save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 poison damage and becomes poisoned for 1 minute.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Grounding System
entries: While wearing your gadgeteer harness you have immunity to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Auto-Injection Regenerator
entries: You install a special kolto injector into your gadgeteer harness that can inject you with kolto in response to pain. When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a Hit Die to regain health as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Autothrusters
entries: You can take the {@action Dash} and {@action Disengage} actions as a bonus action while your jet pack is active.

optionalfeature.name: Climbing Gloves
entries: You craft a set of gloves with a powerful assisted grip. While wearing these gloves, you have a climbing speed of 20 feet, and you have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks that involve climbing.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision Goggles
entries: You craft a pair of sight-enhancing goggles. While wearing these goggles, you have {@sense darkvision} to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, this modification increases its range by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Tank
entries: Your jet pack now lasts up to 10 minutes when activated.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Vents
entries: You learn the {@spell flame sweep} tech power and can cast it at first level without using tech points. Once you have used this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Additionally, while your jet pack is active, you can cast {@spell flame sweep} using your bonus action instead of your action.

optionalfeature.name: Grounding System
entries: While wearing your gadgeteer harness you are immune to the {@condition shocked} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Integrated Inhibitor
entries: While using your harness as a tech focus, you gain a +1 bonus to your tech save DC. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Integrated Targeter
entries: While using your harness as a tech focus, you gain a +1 bonus to tech attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and +3 at 13th level.

optionalfeature.name: Intelligence Core Override
entries: You can cast the override interface tech power at 5th level without spending tech points.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Jet Pack
entries: You integrate a jet pack into your gadgeteer harness to grant you temporary, limited flight. Activating or deactivating the jets requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 30 feet.
The jet pack last for 1 minute before deactivating. Once the jets have been activated, they can’t be activated again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your jet pack’s speed increases to 40 feet at 5th level, 50 feet at 9th level, 60 feet at 13th level, 70 feet at 17th level, and 80 feet at 20th level.

optionalfeature.name: Mechanical Arm
entries: You create a mechanical arm which mounts to your shoulder, which you can use independently. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time.
You can choose this modification twice.

optionalfeature.name: Mimicker
entries: You create a device that attaches to your gadgeteer harness. Your mimicker casts a shadow that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function for 1 minute. Your mimicker is suppressed while you are {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition restrained}, or otherwise unable to move.

optionalfeature.name: Miniturized Hydraulics
entries: Your gadgeteer harness can store 20 pounds of equipment without adding to your encumbrance.

optionalfeature.name: Oil Spill
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell oil slick} tech power without expending tech points. Casting the power in this way does not require concentration, and the oil will remain in place for the full duration of the power.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Powered Grappling Hook
entries: While your wrist-mounted grappling hook is deployed, when you cast a tech power with a range of touch, your hook can deliver the power as if it had cast it.

optionalfeature.name: Prototype Grounding System
entries: While wearing your gadgeteer harness you have resistance to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Start Engine
entries: You can now activate your Jet Pack as an object interaction rather than as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Recycled Adrenals
entries: You can augment a single adrenal to regain its charge. This adrenal can only be used by you, and it can only affect you. Once you’ve used this adrenal, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Recycled Explosives
entries: You can augment a single explosive to regain its charge. This explosive can only be used by you, and it uses your tech save DC instead of its own, unless its own DC would be higher. Once you’ve used this explosive, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Recycled Stimpacs
entries: You can augment a single stimpac to regain its charge. This stimpac can only be used by you, and it can only affect you. Once you’ve used this stimpac, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sentry Turret
entries: You learn how to craft small sentry turrets shaped like globes that can adhere to any surface. As an action or bonus action (your choice), you can throw a sentry to a point you can see within range (30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5). At the end of each of your turns, a deployed sentry automatically targets a hostile creature within 10 feet of it. If multiple targets are available, one is chosen at random. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d4} energy damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of your next turn. If a creature would be targeted by more than one of these sentries, it only makes this saving throw once, taking an additional {@dice d4} damage for each sentry beyond the first.

The sentries have 1 hit point, an armor class of 10, and can be repaired over the course of a long rest. Each sentry lasts for 1 minute before deactivating. You can maintain a number of sentries equal to your Intelligence modifier. Once a sentry has been activated, it can’t be activated again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Hook
entries: After hitting a creature with your grappling hook, you can use the connection to deliver an at-will tech power. As a bonus action, you can cast an at-will tech power at the target with a range of touch. If the power requires an attack roll, you have advantage. If the target requires a saving throw, the target has disadvantage.
Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you recover the hook.

optionalfeature.name: Stealth Field Generator
entries: You create an augmented belt that functions as a portable, personal cloaking device. Activating or deactivating the generator requires a bonus action and, while active, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) ability checks that rely on sight. The generator lasts for 1 minute. This effect ends early if you make an attack or cast a force- or tech- power.
Once the belt has been activated, it can’t be activated again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Barrier
entries: You enhanced your barriers. Whenever a creature with one of your barriers active takes damage from a creature within 5 feet of it, the damaged creature can roll your {@classFeature Potent Aptitude|Engineer|sw5e_phb|1} die, dealing the result of the die as lightning damage to the creature that damaged it.

optionalfeature.name: Truesight Goggles
entries: You modify your goggles with a toggle allowing you to briefly gain enhanced sight. As a bonus action, you can activate the truesight feature of your goggles. When toggled on, for the next minute your goggles now automatically dispel illusions and can detect invisibility, as with truesight.
Once you’ve used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Integration
entries: You can integrate a single weapon that weighs no more than 8 lb. into your gadgeteer harness. While integrated, that weapon gains the hidden and fixed properties.

optionalfeature.name: Wrist-Mounted Grappling Hook
entries: You craft a wrist-mounted grappling hook weapon attached to a tightly coiled cord. With this contraption, you can make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30/60. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d4} kinetic damage. This attack can target a surface, object, or creature.

A creature struck by this attack is impaled by the hook. As an action, a creature can attempt to remove the hook. Removing the hook requires a Strength check. While the hook is stuck in the target, you are connected to the target by a 60 foot cable.

While the hook is deployed, you can use your bonus action to activate the reel, pulling yourself to the location if the target is your size or larger. A creature or object smaller than you is pulled to you. Alternatively, you can opt to release the cable (no action required).
Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you recover and reinsert the hook as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it’s holding. You add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: When you move, you can expend one superiority die, rolling the die and adding the number rolled to your AC until you stop moving.

optionalfeature.name: Feinting Attack
entries: You can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have advantage on your next attack roll against that creature. If that attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die to increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll.
